channel.title: Data Types on Today I Learned
channel.description: Recent content in Data Types on Today I Learned

item.title: Primitive and Non-Primitive Data Types
item.description: Definitions Data Type There is a variety of data types, such as number, boolean, string, null, undefined, etc. Primitive Data Type Numbers Strings Booleans undefined null Primitives are stored by value. Every time a new variable is declared using a primitive data type, a new address in memory is created for that value. let a = 1; let b = a; a has value of 1, which is a Number, a Primitive data type.
